   b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)

   Steps 2, 3 and 4 to occur after that deadline.

   3) FCDO deems the product to be within the agreed* scope in terms of planned purpose and content
   4) FCDO signs off the product

text.Contract title and description: HO Central Postal Services-Premium
text.KPI name and description: End-to-End Deliveries - On-time mailing delivery to the recipient.
text.Comments:
Over the quarter from 26 June to 24 September 2023, Royal Mail delivered 91.3% of Second Class mail within three working days and 74.1% of First Class mail within one working day. Over the period, high levels of vacancies and sick absence were among the main factors contributing to performance levels.
Royal Mail is committed to improving Quality of Service with a clear plan in place, including a quality control centre, recruiting faster than ever before, new sickness, attendance and industry leading health and wellbeing initiatives, including physiotherapy sessions and 24 hour access to GPs, and reinforced operational management and support.
The company has also launched a new quality incentive scheme for operational employees during the peak period, worth up to £500 each for hitting local and national quality targets.
The Business Recovery, Transformation and Growth Agreement - which was approved by a ballot of CWU members in July - provides a platform to improve operational performance and reduce absence. This includes recently introduced attendance and sickness policies, network changes and new seasonal working patterns to improve quality of service. 
While acknowledging that the latest quarter results are disappointing, we can assure the Home Office that improving quality of service is the top priority for our business. 
In the run up to the festive season and our busiest time of year, our main focus has been to take action to address the issues impacting service levels and pull out all the stops to deliver Christmas for our customers.

text.Contract title and description: Strengthening the teaching of primary school mathematics in Malawi
text.KPI name and description:
KPI2
   Set of  submitted quarterly milestones are of good quality as gauged by the Education Adviser (Technical criterion, weight at 50%) and by the Ministry of Education Director of Quality Assurance (government embedding and sustainability criterion, weight at 50%)
   The milestones are of good quality- i.e., technically strong and well embedded into government systems, facilitating government take-up and sustainability”
   1. Technical criterion- The Education Adviser will gauge the quality of submitted milestones as a whole (the set of milestones as a proxy for progress in implementation, not one by one) based on national and international evidence and given analysis of constraints and opportunities; it will also consider Value for Money and innovation. The Adviser will write a short memo accompanying the score (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
    2. Government embedding and sustainability criterion: the Director of Quality Assurance, who is the government coordinator for the programme, will have a quarterly meeting with FCDO which will be minuted, and score whether the set of milestones are embedding the programme in government systems and are considering sustainability (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
   Good: both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target
   Approaching target: both scores are approaching target or one is approaching target and one requires improvement.
   Requires improvement: both scores require improvement or one is requiring improvement and one is inadequate  
   Inadequate: Both scores are inadequate
text.Good target: Both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target

text.KPI name and description:
Provider actively captures and shares lessons learned on own performance and has sought to improve on the last reporting period's performance.
   Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
   • 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   • 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   • 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
   – KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract
